universum.studios.android.ui.widget

Class SeekBarWidget

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.widget.ProgressBar
        • android.widget.AbsSeekBar
          • android.widget.SeekBar
            • universum.studios.android.ui.widget.SeekBarWidget
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable.Callback, AccessibilityEventSource, KeyEvent.Callback, universum.studios.android.font.FontWidget, Widget

    public class SeekBarWidget
extends SeekBar
implements Widget, universum.studios.android.font.FontWidget
    Extended version of SeekBar. This updated SeekBar supports tinting for the Android versions below LOLLIPOP and other useful features described below including discrete mode that should be enabled whenever a particular SeekBarWidget represents setting for which a user needs to know the exact value of the setting.

    Tinting

    Note, that in the current version of SeekBarWidget, tinting for thumb and track below LOLLIPOP is somehow not working properly on all supported Android versions. This issue is scheduled to be resolved in the feature.

    Tinting is supported via Xml attributes listed below:

    • uiThumbTint
    • uiThumbTintMode
    • uiProgressTint
    • uiProgressTintMode
    • uiDiscreteIndicatorTint
    • uiDiscreteIndicatorTintMode

    Note, that on LOLLIPOP and above SDK versions can be also used Xml attributes listed above where in such case will be used the native tinting.

    This widget also overrides all SDK methods used to tint its components like setThumbTintList(android.content.res.ColorStateList) or setThumbTintMode(android.graphics.PorterDuff.Mode), so these can be used regardless the current version of SDK but invoking of these methods below LOLLIPOP can be done only directly upon instance of this widget otherwise NoSuchMethodException will be thrown.

    Discrete mode

    SeekBarWidget with the discrete mode enabled via setDiscrete(boolean) will draw above its progress track and thumb discrete indicator to show to a user current progress value. There will be also drawn tick marks for discrete interval of which range can be specified via setDiscreteIntervalRatio(float). These tick marks should serve as a clue for user so he/she will know more precisely where to drag the thumb to pick its desired progress value.

    Simple view hierarchy model: 

            __
       |28|
        \/
 .---.--O---.---.---.---.---.

    XML attributes

    See SeekBar, SeekBarWidget Attributes

    Default style attribute

    android:seekBarStyle
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

      • SeekBarWidget

                     Context context,
                     @Nullable
                     AttributeSet attrs)
        Same as SeekBarWidget(android.content.Context, android.util.AttributeSet, int) with R.attr.seekBarStyle as attribute for default style.

                     Context context,
                     @Nullable
                     AttributeSet attrs,
                     @AttrRes
                     int defStyleAttr)
        Same as SeekBarWidget(android.content.Context, android.util.AttributeSet, int, int) with 0 as default style.

        defStyleAttr - An attribute which contains a reference to a default style resource for this view within a theme of the given context.
        defStyleRes - Resource id of the default style for the new view.

      • setProgress

        public void setProgress(int progress)
        Overrides:
        setProgress in class ProgressBar

      • setDiscrete

        public void setDiscrete(boolean discrete)
        Sets a flag indicating whether this seek bar is discrete or not.

        SeekBarWidget in the discrete mode draws, above the progress track and the thumb, a discrete indicator to show to a user current progress value. Discrete indicator's drawable can be set via setDiscreteIndicator(android.graphics.drawable.Drawable).

        Parameters:
        discrete - True to enable discrete mode, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        ui:uiDiscrete, isDiscrete()

      • isDiscrete

        public boolean isDiscrete()
        Returns the flag indicating whether this seek bar is discrete or not.
        Returns:
        True if the discrete mode is enabled, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setDiscrete(boolean)

      • setDiscretePreviewEnabled

        public void setDiscretePreviewEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets a flag indicating whether a preview of the discrete indicator is enabled or not. This feature is by default disabled.

        When the preview is enabled, the discrete indicator will be showed whenever a user presses this seek bar widget and will be dismissed after a while if the user does not moves it.

        If this feature is enabled, the indicator will be also previewed whenever is this seek bar attached to the window.

        Parameters:
        enabled - True to enabled discrete preview, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        ui:uiDiscretePreviewEnabled, isDiscretePreviewEnabled()

      • isDiscretePreviewEnabled

        public boolean isDiscretePreviewEnabled()
        Returns the flag indicating whether a preview of the discrete indicator is enabled or not.
        Returns:
        True if discrete preview is enabled, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setDiscretePreviewEnabled(boolean)

      • setDiscreteIntervalRatio

        public void setDiscreteIntervalRatio(float ratio)
        Sets a ratio in which should be drawn tick marks of discrete interval of this seek bar if the discrete mode is enabled by setDiscrete(boolean).

        By default is this ratio set to 0.2f so there will be drawn 6 tick marks.

        Note, that discrete interval has only informational character and do not force a user to pick exactly value represented by one of interval's tick marks.

        Parameters:
        ratio - The desired interval ratio from the range [0.0, 1.0].
        See Also:
        ui:uiDiscreteIntervalRatio, getDiscreteIntervalRatio()

      • getDiscreteIntervalRatio

        public float getDiscreteIntervalRatio()
        Returns the ratio in which are drawn tick marks of discrete interval whenever is the discrete mode enabled.
        Returns:
        Ratio for discrete interval from the range [0.0, 1.0].
        See Also:
        setDiscreteIntervalRatio(float), isDiscrete()

      • setDiscreteIntervalTickMarkRadius

        public void setDiscreteIntervalTickMarkRadius(float radius)
        Sets a radius for the tick mark of a discrete interval. The discrete interval are drawn whenever the discrete mode for this seek bar is enabled via setDiscrete(boolean).
        Parameters:
        radius - The desired radius for tick mark.
        See Also:
        ui:uiDiscreteIntervalTickMarkRadius, getDiscreteIntervalTickMarkRadius()

      • getDiscreteIntervalTickMarkRadius

        public float getDiscreteIntervalTickMarkRadius()

        Returns:
        Tick mark radius.
        See Also:
        setDiscreteIntervalTickMarkRadius(float)

      • setDiscreteIndicator

                                 int resId)
        Same as setDiscreteIndicator(android.graphics.drawable.Drawable) for resource id.
        Parameters:
        resId - Resource id of the desired drawable for discrete indicator. May be 0 to remove the current indicator.

      • setDiscreteIndicator

        public void setDiscreteIndicator(@Nullable
                                 Drawable indicator)
        Sets the drawable used to draw the discrete indicator in discrete mode.
        Parameters:
        indicator - The desired drawable for discrete indicator. May be null to clear the current one.
        See Also:
        ui:uiDiscreteIndicator, setDiscreteIndicatorTintList(ColorStateList), setDiscreteIndicatorTintMode(PorterDuff.Mode), getDiscreteIndicator(), setDiscrete(boolean)

      • getDiscreteIndicator

        @Nullable
public Drawable getDiscreteIndicator()
        Returns the current discrete indicator's drawable.

        Note, that on pre LOLLIPOP Android versions this method will return an instance of TintDrawable if tint has been applied via setDiscreteIndicatorTintList(ColorStateList).

        The original wrapped indicator drawable can be obtained via DrawableWrapper.getDrawable().

        Returns:
        Discrete indicator's drawable.
        See Also:
        setDiscreteIndicator(android.graphics.drawable.Drawable)

      • setDiscreteIndicatorTintList

        public void setDiscreteIndicatorTintList(@Nullable
                                         ColorStateList tint)
        Applies a tint to the discrete indicator, if specified. This call does not modify the current tint mode, which is PorterDuff.Mode.SRC_IN by default.

        Subsequent calls to setDiscreteIndicator(android.graphics.drawable.Drawable) will automatically mutate the drawable and apply the specified tint and tint mode using Drawable.setTintList(android.content.res.ColorStateList).

        Parameters:
        tint - The tint to apply, may be null to clear the current tint.
        See Also:
        ui:uiDiscreteIndicatorTint, getDiscreteIndicatorTintList(), Drawable.setTintList(android.content.res.ColorStateList)

      • getDiscreteIndicatorTintList

        @Nullable
public ColorStateList getDiscreteIndicatorTintList()
        Returns the tint applied to the discrete indicator's drawable, if specified.
        Returns:
        The discrete indicator's drawable tint.
        See Also:
        setDiscreteIndicatorTintList(android.content.res.ColorStateList)

      • setDiscreteIndicatorTintMode

        public void setDiscreteIndicatorTintMode(@Nullable
                                         PorterDuff.Mode tintMode)
        Specifies the blending mode used to apply the tint specified by setDiscreteIndicatorTintList(android.content.res.ColorStateList)} to the discrete indicator. The default mode is PorterDuff.Mode.SRC_IN.
        Parameters:
        tintMode - The blending mode used to apply the tint, may be null to clear the current tint.
        See Also:
        ui:uiDiscreteIndicatorTintMode, getDiscreteIndicatorTintMode(), Drawable.setTintMode(android.graphics.PorterDuff.Mode)

      • getDiscreteIndicatorTintMode

        @Nullable
public PorterDuff.Mode getDiscreteIndicatorTintMode()
        Returns the blending mode used to apply the tint to the discrete indicator's drawable, if specified.
        Returns:
        The discrete indicator's drawable blending mode used to apply the tint.
        See Also:
        setDiscreteIndicatorTintMode(android.graphics.PorterDuff.Mode)

      • setDiscreteIndicatorTypeface

        public void setDiscreteIndicatorTypeface(@Nullable
                                         Typeface typeface,
                                         int style)
        Sets a typeface and style in which the discrete indicator's text should be displayed, and turns on the fake bold and italic bits in the Paint if the Typeface that you provided does not have all the bits in the style that you specified.
        Parameters:
        typeface - The desired typeface. May be null to create default one from the specified style.
        style - One of Typeface.NORMAL, Typeface.BOLD, Typeface.ITALIC or Typeface.BOLD_ITALIC.
        See Also:
        setDiscreteIndicatorTypeface(Typeface), getDiscreteIndicatorTypeface(), getDiscreteIndicatorTypefaceStyle()

      • setDiscreteIndicatorTypeface

        public void setDiscreteIndicatorTypeface(@Nullable
                                         Typeface typeface)
        Sets a typeface in which the discrete indicator's text should be displayed.

        Note, that not all Typeface families actually have bold and italic variants, so you may need to use setDiscreteIndicatorTypeface(Typeface, int) to get the appearance that you actually want.

        Parameters:
        typeface - The desired typeface.
        See Also:
        getDiscreteIndicatorTypeface(), getDiscreteIndicatorTypefaceStyle()

      • getDiscreteIndicatorTypeface

        @Nullable
public Typeface getDiscreteIndicatorTypeface()
        Returns the typeface used to draw text of the discrete indicator.
        Returns:
        Discrete indicator's text typeface.
        See Also:
        setDiscreteIndicatorTypeface(Typeface, int), setDiscreteIndicatorTypeface(Typeface), getDiscreteIndicatorTypefaceStyle(), setDiscreteIndicatorTextAppearance(int)

      • getDiscreteIndicatorTypefaceStyle

        Returns the style of the typeface used to draw the discrete indicator's text.
        Returns:
        Typeface style.
        See Also:

      • setDiscreteIndicatorTextGravity

        public void setDiscreteIndicatorTextGravity(int gravity)
        Sets a gravity to apply to the discrete indicator's text.
        Parameters:
        gravity - The desired gravity flags. One of Gravity.TOP, Gravity.BOTTOM, Gravity.START, Gravity.END, Gravity.CENTER_HORIZONTAL, Gravity.CENTER_VERTICAL, Gravity.CENTER or theirs relevant combination.
        See Also:
        ui:uiDiscreteIndicatorTextGravity, getDiscreteIndicatorTextGravity(), setDiscreteIndicatorTextPadding(int, int, int, int)

      • setDiscreteIndicatorTextPadding

        public void setDiscreteIndicatorTextPadding(int start,
                                            int top,
                                            int end,
                                            int bottom)
        Sets a padding for the discrete indicator's text. The specified padding will be used to position the indicator's text within the indicator's bounds, but will not cause the indicator bounds to change.
        Parameters:
        start - The desired relative start padding. Properly used according to View.getLayoutDirection().
        top - The desired top padding.
        end - The desired relative end padding. Properly used according to View.getLayoutDirection().
        bottom - The desired bottom padding.
        See Also:
        ui:uiDiscreteIndicatorTextPaddingStart, ui:uiDiscreteIndicatorTextPaddingTop, ui:uiDiscreteIndicatorTextPaddingEnd, ui:uiDiscreteIndicatorTextPaddingBottom, getDiscreteIndicatorTextPaddingStart(), getDiscreteIndicatorTextPaddingTop(), getDiscreteIndicatorTextPaddingEnd(), getDiscreteIndicatorTextPaddingBottom(), setDiscreteIndicatorTextGravity(int)

      • getDiscreteIndicatorTextPaddingStart

        public int getDiscreteIndicatorTextPaddingStart()
        Returns the start padding of the discrete indicator's text.
        Returns:
        Indicator's text left padding if layout direction is View.LAYOUT_DIRECTION_LTR, right padding if it is View.LAYOUT_DIRECTION_RTL.
        See Also:
        setDiscreteIndicatorTextPadding(int, int, int, int), setDiscreteIndicatorTextGravity(int)

      • getDiscreteIndicatorTextPaddingTop

        public int getDiscreteIndicatorTextPaddingTop()
        Returns the top padding of the discrete indicator's text.
        Returns:
        Indicator's text top padding.
        See Also:
        setDiscreteIndicatorTextPadding(int, int, int, int), setDiscreteIndicatorTextGravity(int)

      • getDiscreteIndicatorTextPaddingEnd

        public int getDiscreteIndicatorTextPaddingEnd()
        Returns the end padding of the discrete indicator's text.
        Returns:
        Indicator's text right padding if layout direction is View.LAYOUT_DIRECTION_LTR, left padding if it is View.LAYOUT_DIRECTION_RTL.
        See Also:
        setDiscreteIndicatorTextPadding(int, int, int, int), setDiscreteIndicatorTextGravity(int)

      • getDiscreteIndicatorTextPaddingBottom

        See Also:

                        Typeface typeface,

        Description copied from interface: universum.studios.android.font.FontWidget
        Sets a typeface and style in which the text of this font view should be displayed and turns on the fake bold and italic bits in the Paint if the Typeface that you provided does not have all the bits in the style that you specified.

      • setTypeface

        public void setTypeface(@Nullable
                        Typeface typeFace)
        Description copied from interface: universum.studios.android.font.FontWidget
        Sets a typeface in which the text of this view should be displayed.

        Note, that not all Typeface families actually have bold and italic variants, so you may need to use FontWidget.setTypeface(Typeface, int) to get the appearance that you actually want.

        Specified by:
        setTypeface in interface universum.studios.android.font.FontWidget
        Parameters:
        typeFace - The desired typeface. May be null to use a default one.
